nodes.message: After curfew, so Terk kicks students out.

nodes.text: My family has estates in the cities of Balermo and Kattania. We are in the ranks of succession for the throne of Sicilia should anything happen to the Prince's family.
What does that mean?
It means, my dear Katie, that I may one day be the Prince of Sicilia.
Impressive.
What do you want?
You are very good at darts.
Yeah, well, we had a dart board at our inn. I used to play darts with my father's sailors when I was younger. I practiced a lot to get as good as they were.
Poobah is fun and exciting. Is lot like hunting only vith much less bloodshed.
Usually less bloodshed...
Relax. Since when has fretting ever made anything better? What difference does it make if your grades are poor? It's not like a degree in Disbarred Bards is going to look good on a job resume.
Assuming I do not get expelled for poor grades...
Then worry about that when it happens. For now, play a game of cards or something.
The School Thief must be found before they shut down the Disbarred Bards class - you should be out looking for the thief rather than wasting time here.
But Caesari...
We'll talk about this later. I see the chief suspect has just walked into the room.
Maybe things will settle down to normal now that the thief has been caught.
There's a normal for here? Is alvays something going on.
You can't learn how to play Poobah from reading a book any more than you can learn how to throw a dagger from reading.

I learned a lot about throwing a dagger from reading a book. That's how I improved my throwing skill. And the Poobah book explains things like the mathematical likelihood that one person has a Fizbin when another person has a Poobah.
Since when has math had anything to do with having fun?
I've always found math challenging and enjoyable.
Why does that not surprise me?
We could go explore more of the Sea Caves rather than hang out here.
Sorry - but Gogs taste like rotten fish and Zombie Pirates smell horrid. Is good idea to stay avay from Sea Caves. They are nasty places.
Well, nasty or not, I'm going down to the Sea Caves soon. I'll uncover the Sea Caves secrets if it kills me.
Be careful. Death is not vorst thing that can happen to you there.
Yeah, I know.
I can't believe you can still show your face around here. This isn't over, Conner. You will be kicked out of here one way or another.
I'm so glad we can have these little talks, Caesari. It does my heart good to see you so happy.
I can't believe you haven't been kicked out of the school by now.
Just lucky, I guess.
So what about you? Do you have any plans for your future?
I am happy here. It is first place that seemed like home to me. Is so nice to have true friends like you.
I never really had any friends growing up. It is a new experience for me to have friends I can rely upon and trust. So I get what you mean.
You should come with me to the Catacombs, Caesari. You will see for yourself why there are rumors of treasures there - and why it is so dangerous.
Why would I want to accompany you to a graveyard when you can easily do it for yourself?
But Caesari, there are many places in the Catacombs where I do not dare to venture by myself. But together you and I...
We'll talk about this later. Conner just came in.
Looks like we're the only ones who braved the Nights of the Dead.
Vhat is there to be afraid of? The ghosts in the castle are all good. They protect things here.
Every Night of the Dead, we have two ghostly sailors come to my family's inn. We always had a table set aside for them with ale and food. I thought of them as old friends.
Of course, very few living people came to the inn on these nights. They probably hid at home under their blankets and shivered until daybreak.
These Drats are so annoying! It's stupid having to sneak around the school to avoid them.
<shrug> At least ve can get past them vithout vasting too much time. Other students have to fight Drats everyvhere.
Well, someone better stop the Drat infestation soon. What good is a school for heroes if no one acts like one?

What game is the sport of kings? Poobah, Poobah. It's cards and bluffing, Betting rings, Oh, the Poobah way! Going to play all night, Until the break of light, Bet my money on a Poobah hand, Hope someone starts to play!"
It's catchy, but I think it needs work.
Is very clever, Aeolus!
Maybe I should go study for the final now. It vould be bad to fail this last test.
I don't think that there's any amount of studying needed to pass the Master's tests. I think Gerhard wants us to think about his questions rather than what the answers should be.
Besides, we're Rogues. We don't need to take a test to prove it.
It's sad to think that this may be the last time we all play Poobah together. I've rather enjoyed our time together.
I thought you didn't like the game.
I don't enjoy games in general. Somebody always loses.
<shrug> Just like life.
People don't have to lose at life. That's what Heroes are for - to help other people win.
You vill be fine Hero, Thomas. You vill help many people vin at life.
Okay, so here ve are, all alone by ourselves late at night.
